strategyDetails:
Ice Fang hits many threats like Salamence, Hydreigon, Mandibuzz, and Tapu Bulu. However, Gyarados requires multiple boosts to reliably KO bulky Grass-types like Tangrowth and Amoonguss with it. Bounce can be used over Ice Fang, as it can more reliably KO a chipped Amoonguss with just one boost. However, Bounce requires a Power Herb as the item to limit its exploitability from Protect, Substitute, or switching. Even so, once the Power Herb is consumed Gyarados will still fall victim to these issues. Power Whip offers essential coverage against bulky Water-types like Quagsire, Slowking, and Rotom-W. Moxie is the preferred ability, as it enables Gyarados to snowball through a team after one or two boosts. Lum Berry allows Gyarados to freely setup twice against foes like Chansey and Toxic Excadril. Mystic Water is an alternative option to let Gyarados break through Celesteela, Skarmory, and Mandibuzz much easier with Waterfall, letting it break through the latter two with only one flinch instead of two at +1. On more bulky offense teams, Heavy-Duty Boots can be used to prevent Stealth Rock damage, allowing Gyarados to switch in more frequently. An Adamant nature is preffered for extra wallbreaking power, as Gyarados doesn't outspeed anything notable with a Jolly nature and it guarantees an OHKO on Azumarill with unboosted Power Whip as well as Thundurus-T with +1 Ice Fang.

Gyarados is best used on hyper offense and bulky offense teams due to the offensive pressure it offers. Gyarados is primarily used as a late-game cleaner, but it struggles against defensive Pokemon like Chansey and Amoonguss. A teammate that offers entry hazard support like Krookodile and Excadrill helps wear these foes down enough for Gyarados to break through them. Both of these Pokemon can absorb Electric-type attacks and keep Stealth Rock off with Taunt or Rapid Spin, allowing Gyarados to use Lum Berry or Mystic Water. Roserade can provide Spikes support to help wear down foes like Aegislash and Amoonguss. Early game wallbreakers like Aegislash, Diggersby, and Nasty Plot Thundurus-T can break through walls like Mandibuzz, Chansey, and Celesteela, allowing Gyarados to clean these typically bulky threats up more easily. Sticky Web setters like Ribombee can make up for Gyarados's mediocre Speed tier and prevent Choice Scarf users like Mienshao revenge killing it.
